text: When Rehoboam arrived in Jerusalem, he summoned 180,000 skilled warriors from Judah and Benjamin to attack Israel and restore the kingdom to Rehoboam.
But the Lord’s message came to the prophet Shemaiah,

“<st data-num="0559 0559">Say</st> this <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="07346" class="">Rehoboam</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> and <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="03478" class="">Israelites</st> in <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> and <st data-num="01144" class="">Benjamin</st>,
‘The Lord says this: “Do not attack and make war with your brothers. Each of you go home, for I have caused this to happen.”’” They obeyed the Lord and called off the attack against Jeroboam.
Rehoboam lived in Jerusalem; he built up these fortified cities throughout Judah:
<st data-num="01129 01035">Bethlehem</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05862" class="">Etam</st>, <st data-num="08620" class="">Tekoa</st>,
<st data-num="01049" class="">Beth Zur</st>, <st data-num="07755" class="">Soco</st>, <st data-num="05725" class="">Adullam</st>,
<st data-num="01661" class="">Gath</st>, <st data-num="04762" class="">Mareshah</st>, <st data-num="02128" class="">Ziph</st>,
<st data-num="0115" class="">Adoraim</st>, <st data-num="03923" class="">Lachish</st>, <st data-num="05825" class="">Azekah</st>,

<st data-num="06881" class="">Zorah</st>, <st data-num="0357" class="">Aijalon</st>, and <st data-num="02275" class="">Hebron</st>. <st data-num="0834">These</st> were the <st data-num="04694" class="">fortified</st> <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st> in <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> and <st data-num="01144" class="">Benjamin</st>.

He <st data-num="02388" class="">fortified</st> these <st data-num="04694" class="">cities</st> and <st data-num="05414" class="">placed</st> <st data-num="05057" class="">officers</st> in them, as well as <st data-num="0214" class="">storehouses</st> of <st data-num="03978" class="">food</st>, <st data-num="08081" class="">olive oil</st>, and <st data-num="03196" class="">wine</st>.
In each city there were shields and spears; he strongly fortified them. Judah and Benjamin belonged to him.
The priests and Levites who lived throughout Israel supported him, no matter where they resided.
The Levites even left their pasturelands and their property behind and came to Judah and Jerusalem, for Jeroboam and his sons prohibited them from serving as the Lord’s priests.

Jeroboam<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05975" class="">appointed</st> his own <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st> to serve at the <st data-num="01116" class="">worship centers</st><n id="2" /> and to lead in the worship of the <st data-num="08163" class="">goat idols</st> and <st data-num="05695" class="">calf idols</st> he had <st data-num="0834 06213">made</st>.<n id="3" />
Those among all the Israelite tribes who were determined to worship the Lord God of Israel followed them to Jerusalem to sacrifice to the Lord God of their ancestors.
They supported the kingdom of Judah and were loyal to Rehoboam son of Solomon for three years; they followed the edicts of David and Solomon for three years.
Rehoboam married Mahalath the daughter of David’s son Jerimoth and of Abihail, the daughter of Jesse’s son Eliab.

She <st data-num="03205" class="">bore</st> him <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> named <st data-num="03266" class="">Jeush</st>, <st data-num="08114" class="">Shemariah</st>, and <st data-num="02093" class="">Zaham</st>.

He <st data-num="0310" class="">later</st> <st data-num="03947" class="">married</st> <st data-num="04601" class="">Maacah</st> the <st data-num="01323" class="">daughter</st> of <st data-num="053" class="">Absalom</st>. She <st data-num="03205" class="">bore</st> to him <st data-num="029" class="">Abijah</st>, <st data-num="06262" class="">Attai</st>, <st data-num="02124" class="">Ziza</st>, and <st data-num="08019" class="">Shelomith</st>.
Rehoboam loved Maacah daughter of Absalom more than his other wives and concubines. He had eighteen wives and sixty concubines; he fathered twenty-eight sons and sixty daughters.
Rehoboam appointed Abijah son of Maacah as the leader over his brothers, for he intended to name him his successor.
He wisely placed some of his many sons throughout the regions of Judah and Benjamin in the various fortified cities. He supplied them with abundant provisions and acquired many wives for them.
